success: Your blade finds flesh. The impact shudders up your arm. It staggers back, hurt but not finished.
Steel meets corruption. The creature reels, ichor spraying. You've wounded it. It knows pain now.
You swing true. The blow lands solid, driving the thing back a step. Blood — or something like blood — flows.
A clean hit. The creature howls — or tries to, with what's left of its throat. You've hurt it badly.
Your weapon bites deep. The creature's eyes widen with something like surprise. It didn't expect you to fight back.
mutual: You swing. It swings. Both connect. Pain blooms in your side as the creature staggers. Fair trade. Barely.
Steel meets claw. You tear into each other. Neither retreats. Blood mingles — yours and whatever passes for its.
A vicious exchange. You hurt it. It hurt you. The math of violence: both numbers go down.
Your blade sinks in as its claws rake across you. Agony and satisfaction, tangled together.
You cut deep. Its teeth find your arm. Mutual destruction. Mutual determination. Neither of you will stop.
weak: The blow glances off. Not enough. It barely notices, already lunging for you.
You strike, but the angle is wrong. It absorbs the hit and keeps coming. This will take more.
Your weapon connects, but weakly. The creature laughs — or makes the sound where laughter should be.

success: You twist aside at the last moment. Claws slice through empty air. The creature stumbles past, exposed.
Pure instinct. Your body moves before your mind decides. The attack misses by inches. You feel the wind of it.
You're not where it expected. Its strike hits nothing. For a heartbeat, it's confused. Use that.
Too slow. It's too slow. You dance around its lunge, untouched, already positioning for the counter.
The attack passes through where you were. You're somewhere else now. Somewhere safe. Somewhere ready.
close: Almost. You almost dodge cleanly. A claw catches your shoulder — grazing, not gutting. Still stings.
You move, but not quite fast enough. The edge of the attack finds you. Pain, but survivable.
Close enough to feel the air pressure. Close enough that it rips cloth but not flesh. Next time, be faster.

success: You raise your guard. The impact rattles your bones, but you hold firm. Reduced, not eliminated.
You plant your feet and take it. The blow lands, but your stance absorbs most of the force. You're still standing.
Brace. Absorb. Endure. The creature's attack crashes against your defense. Painful. Survivable.
The impact shudders through you, but you've turned a killing blow into a bruising one. You can work with bruises.
You grit your teeth and weather it. The pain is real but distant. You're still here. Still fighting.
broken: You brace, but it's stronger than you expected. Your guard breaks. Not all the damage gets through. Enough does.
The force is overwhelming. Your stance holds, barely, but something in your arm pops. Still better than the alternative.

heal: Bitter leaves. Bitter medicine. Warmth spreads through you as wounds close, pain recedes. The taste lingers.
You crush the herbs and press them to your wounds. Healing comes fast down here — survival demands it.
The herbs burn going down, but the burning is good. Cleansing. You feel strength return.
Ancient remedies. They work here, in the dark, where modern medicine fears to tread. You're mending.
You eat what looks like rot and tastes like hope. Your body remembers health. Your wounds remember to close.
interrupted: You reach for the herbs. It reaches for you. The healing happens, but so does the hurting.
No time to enjoy the medicine. It strikes while you're distracted. Worth it? The healing says yes. The pain says maybe.

success: You turn and run. Survival over pride. The darkness swallows you before it can follow.
Flight. Not cowardice — tactics. You disengage, sprinting for the passage. Behind you, frustrated sounds.
You break away, legs pumping, lungs burning. It doesn't chase. It doesn't need to. There's always another way.
Running isn't losing. Running is choosing to fight later, somewhere else, on your terms. You run.
You flee. The word tastes bitter, but you're alive to taste it. That's what matters.
hurt: You run. A claw catches your back — parting gift. Blood flows, but so do your legs. Distance grows.
Escape isn't free. It takes a chunk of you as you go. The price of flight. Still cheaper than the price of failure.
You flee, but not fast enough. Not clean enough. It marks you before you're gone. A reminder.

AGGRESSIVE: Preparing to strike with full force
Muscles tensing for a brutal attack
Rearing back for a devastating blow
Coiling like a spring about to release
DEFENSIVE: Watching your weapon, not your eyes
CHARGING: Preparing something you don't want to see
ERRATIC: Jerking left, then right, then forward
Impossible to read, impossible to predict
HUNTING: Waiting for you to make a mistake
